Reviews.Title: “3-star hotel, at best”
Reviews.Author: ARaaf
Reviews.Content: In their guest feedback pamphlet Majestic states that they're aiming to be a 5-star property with 4-star prices. Nothing could be further from the truth - This hotel should be rated maximum 3-stars. The rooms are spacious but the furniture looks outdated and cheap. The quality of bed linen and beauty products is terrible. The bathroom has a water heater(!) that the guest should engage before taking a shower -I'd like to know how many guests deal with cold showers since the switch is difficult to see. There is no WiFi in the rooms, and the hotel charge a fortune for internet through ethernet cable. Service at check-in/out is relatively fast but it's not personal at all.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: ayushmanc
Reviews.Content: The hotel claims 5 star service at 4 star prices. I have travellied a lot - across all types of hotels. There service levels are not a match for a 3 star hotel also. The hotel staff feels they are doing a favour by doing there job. And, i must add , this is not a one off bad experience, this was the case with more than 80% of the staff. Right from the Duty Manager downwards. I was there for 3 nights - will never be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “There must be better”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: 27 floors and two small elevators. Indifferent staff who relish the challenge of arguing or dismissing you. Good size rooms, nice breakfast. The greek restaurant is nice, but they won't deliver to your room. Not really focused on customer satisfaction, but it is quiet and clean. Cleaning staff simply make the bed, change towels and clean porcelain. You are here in the "old" part of town. Dubai mall is 25aed away....

Reviews.Title: “Not Five-Stars by any means”
Reviews.Author: PelleH
Reviews.Content: First of all: this is not a "Five-Star Hotel at Four Star rate" (their slogan) by any means. It's an OK hotel in a good location but: 1) The shower was completely useless, glad I didn't have to wash my hair 2) There were 16 sunbeds for a 24 floor hotel, ridiculous. You have to be by the pool at a very early hour to get one 3) The poolbar was supposed to open at noon but no one was in sight until 12.30. And they were supposed to serve Greek Salad with Feta (of course) but contriary to the Greek Restaurant 5 meters away they served White Cheese instead for the same price 4) Why have a hotel with balconys in every room when you have to call housekeeping to open it and there are no chairs or tables out there ? And they obviously never clean them, they were VERY dirty But: 1) The Greek Restaurant was great 2) The room (at 23rd floor) was fantastic in size. And the view was great 3) The English Pub was great

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the centre of Bur Dubai”
Reviews.Author: 1businesstraveller
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel on booking.com at a very competitive price. When I arrived the check-in was fast and all information needed for use of wifi was given. The wifi is free while in the lobby and chargeable in the rooms. As I already had my particulars on the hotel system from a previous stay, I was very fortunately given a free upgrade to a 1 bed apartment, which was very spacious, clean, bright and had two balconies. The air-con was super efficient and they provide two door keys so that one can be used to have the air-con on the whole time. Although I did not use the kitchen, it was perfectly agreeable for cooking any meal with great cupboard space for food etc on a long stay. The breakfast was rather average, although there is an egg station with chef and also interestingly a separate table with heated pan for those wanting pork sausages etc for breakfast. The hotel is quiet and I had a room on the 18th floor. The bedroom was spacious, as was the living area. My 3 night stay was most agreeable and I would use again even if the opportunity for a free upgrade were not available.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the view!”
Reviews.Author: ge0rge0rwell
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean room with splendid view of Dubai! Would have liked some furniture on balcony and we had to ask the reception for the balcony to be un-locked (maybe they are worried about people falling down, haha) Can't complain about anything really, it's a nice hotel and you get what you pay for. The staff seemed a little gloomy and blasé sometimes though. Maybe they would use a day at the beach.. In the end of the day we had a lovely few days here so thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view of Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Utkarsh S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in during the Dubai Shopping Festival for 5 nights here. Being my first trip to Middle East and Dubai in particular I had high expectations from it. And upon entering the hotel I was not a bit disappointed. Perfect location close to Airport (10-15 mins cab ride) and right in Bur Dubai. The rooms are amazingly clean and comfortable beds, bathrooms also top class. We were lucky to get the Superior rooms on 13 floor which is the only floor to have a Balcony attached. Room was facing the glorious Burj Khalifa and even the distant Burj al Arab and looks wonderful at night where you can almost see entire Dubai even from the 13th floor as it is unblocked view. There are plenty to amenities within the hotel too. The hotel staff was very warm. My only complaint was that in this day and age there is no free wi-fi in the rooms. There is only Free wi-fi in the bar next to reception and a bit of signal reaching the seating area opp the reception. There was this wonderful Kamats Indian Vegetarian restaurant around 10 mins walk from the hotel too. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Gauwas
Reviews.Content: On my two days business trip, I chose this hotel for two main reasons the price and location. It is nearby AlFuhaid Metro Station for those who like to do some walking like myself, which will allow you to visit many famous places in Dubai. The price is better than many other hotels in the same rank, which I think it should be 3- 3.5 stars. For swimming pools lovers, the pool is supposedly heated, however, I met a couple shivering coming out of the pool. Consequently, I had to really warm up before jumping into the pool and do my laps. I didn't eat at the hotel as I was invited many times outside. Room was super clean. The room location is great if you are looking for somewhere in the middle of Dubai for a descent price. One last thing, staff was friendly, she tried to get me the room I wanted but was not available and I got stuck with a room with another building view.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel, very well location”
Reviews.Author: pleasure721
Reviews.Content: very new , clean and friendly hotel right in the center of Bur Dubai

Reviews.Title: “Good location,good restaurant, value for money”
Reviews.Author: mlou_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to Al Fahidi metro station, which is convinient for transporation all over the city. Don't expect to have a great view from your room, however the rooms are good size, bathrooms are big, staff is friendly and food is excellent. Stayed there in january for 4 nights on a family trip. we were given the family suite which is a 2 bedroom suite, veryconvinient for families, since it also has a dining table for 4 persons. The swimming pool is small and located at the 2nd floor of the building. the only issue we had was the lifts. It is annoying if you have to wait for 10 minutes to go from the breakfast area to your room

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WestMidlandsKout
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel, the staff are lovely and go out of their way to help. Nothing is too much for them, we arrived early morning and they had a room ready for us by 10:30. Excellent food and restaurants, our most enjoyable meals were at the hotel. Good pool area, however the sun is blocked by the tall buildings that surround the hotel so it’s not great for sun worshippers. It was my husband’s bday while we were out there, the hotel kindly sent up a gorgeous bday cake, compliments of the hotel. It was such a kind gesture. We would recommend this hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel in a commercial district.”
Reviews.Author: londongirl05
Reviews.Content: Taxis were needed to get anywhere a tourist would want to go to. Taxis were easily available and cheap. The breakfasts were good and the on site Greek restaurant was excellent and well worth a visit, even if you are not staying at the hotel. Staff were helpful and friendly. My biggest criticism is the lifts. There are only two small lifts. We stayed on the 22nd floor and this meant we spent large child of time waiting for the lift.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for a Short Stay..!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigbgowda
Reviews.Content: Had been to this place for a short while as on a transit, but extended a day more. Good Location, easy approach, Nice and clean rooms, well furnished, good courtesy extended by the staff, Nice greek restaurant and sports bar..!! Have the Wifi free facility and the business center for any official works, Over all a good place and a value for money..!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: KaushalK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Majestic Hotel for 6 days in Nov - Dec 2011. I would rate this hotel very high. There were 3 of us and we had booked a deluxe room. The hotel management was nice enough to automatically upgrade our room to the Family Suite on the 23rd Floor.......!! The rooms were spacious and very well furnished and clean. Bathroom was equally good too. The Icing on the cake were the balconies. We got 2 of them and they gave a superb view of the Dubai Skyline including the Burj Khalifa in all its glory. The Tirquaz Restaurant was pretty nice for breakfast and offered a wide variety of food. The staff were exceptionally polite and helpful. To sum it up, I would say this is a 4 star hotel with 5 star facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Bule_belanda
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, little limited in elevator capacity Great Greek restaurant Nice sportsbar

Reviews.Title: “nice choice for business”
Reviews.Author: arthurIzmir
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for business trips.Easy location , quite spacious rooms , good room service , a good mini-bar , nice breakfast , friendly staff.What you get for what you pay is fair enough.Price is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Shekerim
Reviews.Content: This is a good value hotel in Bur Dubai.Exteriors and interiors of the hotel are nice.Breakfast is nice although it is not changing at all. Executive Deluxe room was spacious and nice design. Minus was the smoke smell coming to room. also in the lobby it smelled like a tobacco shop. Location is quite nice. Personnel were very nice.1km walk to nearest metro which is by the way outstanding. taxis are also cheap and there is no cheating at all. the drivers are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel - Under staffed”
Reviews.Author: swap_g12
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Deluxe Room. Big Size rooms. Majestic View of the city - Just awesome. Big Bathtub.Very good Hotel.Breakfast was cool , with lots of variety but lots of repetetions also. Hotel pickup from airport - AED 50. Airport drop by taxi AED 26. Checkin was a big pain , A Big Hotel & 2 people for check in.Was given a room on 7th floor , but insisted for a higher room & than got a room on 20th Floor with awesome city view. Had Lunch once - Buffet - AED 65 per person , very good spread & taste. Spotlessly clean. Very good. Location is not very good but not bad also. Al Fahadi stn 5 mins walk on the Green line. Shopping centers & resturants 3 to 4 mins walk. All in all Worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: lokeshnathany
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 to 5 nights in April 2011. The hotel is centrally located in BUR DUBAI, closed to both shopping areas and business districts. The rooms are clean and well equipped. The staff is helpful. Small lobby as compared to other hotels in the same range and not so well lit as well. They have excellent lounges like MUSIC ROOM. Overall a nice place to stay both for business and holiday traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Dubai Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LDN_Lady
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of September. The good: - Location: not to far from the airport, shopping malls, Old Town (gold, spice and textile souks) the walk to the metro station isn't too bad either, though due to the extreme heat, I would advise you to just get taxi everywhere, as it is relatively cheap to get to most places in Dubai from this hotel. - Staff: the staff really are what make this hotel. Especially Florentina from Housekeeping and Eme in Guest Relations, both really looked after us during our stay. Also on our day at the hotel, we had a very late flight and had been on a jeep safari excursion. We had already checked out, but the reception staff allowed us to use the gym facilities to have a shower and freshen up, which was well needed after being in the hot, dusty desert all evening. - Restaurants: There are a few restaurants, bars and cafes in the hotel. Elia the Greek restaurant does delicious food. Tirquaz does a good breakfast buffet, while I found there were a few items repeated such as juice, tea, toast, omelettes and pancakes, other items on the breakfast menu did vary from day to day. Also worth taking a trip to Kanto the Filipino bar, they do karaoke there some nights and that was a lot of fun. The Lavazza cafe is a good place to chill for a bit though nothing to shout about. These restaurants are also where you will be able to use the hotel's wifi connection. The not so good: Rooms: while comfortable, you can see they are a bit worn and could do with redecorating/refurnishing. Though they do have modern flat screen TV’s and a few English channels to watch. You only get two complimentary bottles of water on your first night, after that you have to buy them from the expensive minibar, so I would advise taking a visit to the local supermarket and stocking up. Also, our room wasn't vacuumed properly on arrival (check next to the beds, and behind chairs and curtains). We had to call housekeeping to rectify this, which I must say they did very quickly and after this there wasn't a problem with the cleaning throughout the rest of our stay. Internet: There is NO wifi connection in the rooms, only in the communal areas (restaurant, lobby etc). If you want internet in your room you have to connect via a lead and it's quite pricey. For a hotel that advertises itself as 4* with 5* service, surely wifi connection in all rooms would be standard? I've been able to get wifi in my room at much cheaper budget chain hotels. Elevators: there are only 2 lifts that service the entire hotel. There is always quite a wait for the lifts, but I suppose this is to be expected as it's such a tall building. Overall it is a decent hotel and a good base to explore Dubai from. I would recommend staying there, however make sure you don't pay over the odds if you do.

Reviews.Title: “ON VARIOUS PARAMETERS”
Reviews.Author: aaloknigam
Reviews.Content: Excellent on Cleanliness and Orderliness;Staff is friendly;Breakfast included in Tariff and is good;We stayed for 4 nights and had a variety of food;Lobby is small if you have to wait;sofa's are not too clean-my wife noticed that;have to take Taxi for even going to Metro Station;better buy Bottled Water from outside (too expensive in Hotel) as after complimentary 2 Bottles are finished they are not replenished. the major issue I had was with the DEPOSIT of AED 800 which was insisted upon on check-in even though our Full Stay was paid for in advance;the Check-in Manager (James) was arrogant and his body language was as if we were "THIEF'S" It was if you don't deposit you cannot check in.I even offered to deposit equivalent Dollars or British Pounds in Cash and would take it back on Check Out.I was very curtly told that Dollars would be converted into Dirhams @ 3.38 as against 3.61 at Airport or 3.65 at Money Changer( the official rate is 3.67);No option and I was given impression that the matter could be settled by giving my Credit Card as guarantee;I thought that it is like only a Guarantee as it has happened in many Hotels else in USA (they do not ask for guarantee if booked thru Agent in Singapore or Malaysia traveled recently).Next when I come back and see my emails I come to know that I have a debit of AED 800 along with Foreign Exchange Transaction charge.On writing to Hotel it was reversed but I again lost money as Hotel now exchanges it at 3.67 (the official rate)so they buy at 3.38 and sell at 3.67.Imagine how many guests fleeced this way every day and each guest looses even US$ 20 what an amount.the Hotel. I thought of highlighting this issue(even it is a small amount but one feels CHEATED). alok nigam

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ras Al Khaimah, United Arab Emirates
Reviews.Title: “Best in its price range in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Neil-RAK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 times now - very nice rooms, spotlessly clean, very friendly and efficient staff. Valet parking is a big plus. The Music Room venue next door has great live bands.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with GREAT value!”
Reviews.Author: Fayoula
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was ideal, near the airport, Dubai Mall, Jumeirah beach, exhibition center. Taxis were easy to get. All the staff was smiling, friendly and went the extra mile to serve. The room was immaculately clean and tasteful. We got a free upgrade and allowed to check in early. The room had a breathtaking view of Dubai's skyscrapers including the tallest building in the world Burj Khalifa. It's an experience. There's a great choice for restaurants, but you must try Elia which is Greek food - it's such a nice place and the food exceptional. Breakfast was varied and a great selection. And there's a live music club with a great band playing pop soul, funk, rock... Swimming pool is very nice too. Good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Busy but well located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SkupMI
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for business, since is located in the hearth of Bur Dubai. From there, you can easily reach exhibition center, Deira offices, Al Quds Industrial Area. Is not the best place for entertainement, since main attractions and malls of Dubai are quite far from here. The hotel is clean, well equipped, rooms are very ok. A little problem with elevator: sometimes too much time waiting your turn. The buffet breakfast is great, and you also have a choice of several restaurants. Staff is friendly and well trained. Is a good value to your money. Definitively suggested.

Reviews.Title: “Good Comfort and Quite Accessible”
Reviews.Author: rayineedi
Reviews.Content: We are 7 family members stayed in hotel majetic for 5 days, all i could say is the accomodation is thoroughly comfortable. We got 2 deluxe king size bed rooms, having bolcony with the view of city skyscrapers. The view is really spectacular escpecially at night. You wont regret to stay here with the comfort of 5 star category though it is 4 star. The only disadvantage i experianced is with the elavator. They have only 2 elavators for the 24 storied hotel which takes bit time to get our turn to use it. But that can be excepted for the rest facilities. I strongly recommend this hotel which is quite accesible to the popular shopping malls and Gold Sukh.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with good value”
Reviews.Author: Mohi_Khater
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in Bur Dubai area and close to many attractions in the city. The hotel upgrades our room to suite for free. The hotel stuff is friendly and helpful especially at the main restaurant. I tried food at the main restaurant only and it was wonderful with a lot of varieties. The room was clean and spacious. You can realize it is little bit old. However, they maintain the rooms in good standard. The rates are competitive and for my experience it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We hated it and won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: Sole reception desk clerk was rude and English was poor. No concierge service available at this hotel meaning we had to deal with reception and if busy had to wait. Couldn't get broadband reception in lobby. Clerk was more interested in chasing up payment for a room service we didn't order and wouldn't help us so we gave up. Breakfast menu is very limited and food quality was very poor, perhaps because of low season. Room was large and clean. TV reception was poor. Upside was they allowed us a 3 pm checkout but hotel was almost empty anyway. Stayed 3 nights in Aug 2011 with wife. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Just right...”
Reviews.Author: Travelguy365
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with the right price and amenities. Room was comfortable and I had a 13th floor view of downtown Dubai that was the best I have had in Dubai. Bed very comfortable. Good pool and small, but adequate gym. Breakfast was great with in a charming room. There was a disturbance incident with a "lady" in the hotel lobby and it was handled very professionally by the hotel's security. The guard kept his demeanor and handled the situation appropriately. This speaks for the employee's of the hotel. The only negatives is that the hotel advertises for free internet. It is not in the room (there is a charge for that--80 dirhams a day!)..but in the lobby and coffee cafe where the wifi is free. That and when I asked about getting ice for the room, I was instucted to call room service. What I was not told is that there is a charge for frozen water...7 dirhams ($2). Definitely not needed...I was tipping 5 dirhams anyway..just not right for this level of a hotel. Nice bars for a great evening. The same Dubai prices everywhere..somewhat expensive if you want a alcoholic beverage. Will be back..and hopefully on that great 13th floor!!

Reviews.Title: “LOST & FOUND!”
Reviews.Author: ELLY070
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel in March with a bunch of friends. We have decided to visit Dubai again and to stay at the Majestic, again. They gave us a brilliant room, with a breathtaking view of the Highest Tower in the World - Burj Khalifa. We were awed by the Dubai skytline for 3 consecutive evenings! We spent early evenings at some Iconic landmarks at it was a breeze to travel from the Hotel to our destination, the location was indeed very strategic! The food was great too! I eat healthy. I am glad thay are pro-healthy foods! Lastly, as we are so engrossed with all our escapades, we hurriedly checked out on the last day. Whilst in the plane, while rummaging through my stuffs, I thought I have lost my DIGITAL CAMERA - MY MEMORIES OF DUBAI. Then I remembered I have placed it on my bed while collecting my hand carry. I immediately notified the hotel's info address and have informed of my item. The Management have responded immediately and have gone the extra mile in order for me to get my Camera back! I sooooo, appreciate their effort. In a week's time, I have received my VALUABLE CAMERA via courier - though they charge me collect for the courier cost, I sooooooo dont mind, I had my MEMORIES BACK!!!!! I hope, through this message, I would be able to sincerely express how much I appreciate their efforts. KUDOS to the entire Management and Staff of the Majestic Hotel! I will definetely come back to experience a Majestic Service soon!

Reviews.Title: “The Service is the Key”
Reviews.Author: nicolo1209
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on the district very strategic to the shopping places and the airport. It is priced not too steep, and the facilities are very enticing. The rooms are clean and have a fantastic view of Dubai. The sheets are white, and the curtains without dust. There is also cable TV with many channel selections. For the price of a four star hotel, this should may well be a five star hotel. They also have a buffet breakfast which has a wide selection however not attractive for someone who is not a fan of pork-less dishes. But what made the stay memorable is the service of the people. The reception was not as friendly to guests as they were cranky at times, but the service in the restaurant is heart-warming. Waiters and waitresses smile to you all the time and attend to your every concern. During my stay, the hotel elevator broke down. Since my room was on the 14th floor, I had to endure traveling the stairs which, in retrospect, were a claustro-nightmare in the event that there was a fire in the building. The stairs were very narrow and I felt that it might be hazardous to people who would be using this as an emergency exit. It is very accessible to some of the supermarkets, money changers, coffee shops, fastfood outlets and clothes market (5 minutes on foot). But if you want some hardcore shopping in the Mall of the Emirates, taxis are available at around 15 to 20 minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: bizLeisure
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Bur Dubai and is extremely convenient for meetings in Dubai. Also the hotel has a business centre and meeting rooms so you could host a meeting here as well. I was on the 20th floor and the view of Dubai from there was great. The staff is very helpful and warm. The rooms are extremely comfortable though slightly small.

Reviews.Title: “great place we loved it”
Reviews.Author: tani5
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 11 nights and the place was nice and friendly the staff was great very pleasent the hotel is very clean and quite central to all the hot spots would go back there when next in dubai

Reviews.Title: “definately not 5 star services at 4 star prices”
Reviews.Author: karunesh
Reviews.Content: i stayed with a friend 6 nights. check in was a headache. having booked a deluxe room, i was offred standard room. it took 1 hour to sort out the issue. room size was ok. night club 'the music room' remains mostly empty...so not good for night life lovers. same boring breakfast menu every day. guests in room charged 150 AED additionally surprisingly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jholapara
Reviews.Content: stayed here in majestic on a family trip. Our group was quite big, well i found this hotel quite easy to access with the surrounding. Nice Location and quite central. that is if your looking for a trip to Dubai for usual tourist spots. hotel overall was quite satisfying. very economical rates.food was decent. I would definitely recommend this hotel if your on business trips. Decor and the feel of the hotel can improve, nothing new in terms of architecture or interiors, but doesn't mean its bad with what they got now. nice feel to the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Kikay11
Reviews.Content: We came in a group and immediately received a warm welcome starting from valet up until we have reached our rooms. A cake was presented to a Friend who happened to be celebrating her birthday. All were friendly during our short stay. The room was just right for twin sharing. Everything that we needed was just within reach - shopping malls, the beach, the Souqs, the Museum. It was very close to the Metro too! There were various restaurants in the hotel and their food was great. The spend was all worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Economical stay”
Reviews.Author: Gulabani
Reviews.Content: The price rates according to the service rooms and overall structure of the hotel is economical and 24hrs room service available... Its located in the heart of the city very near to very famous fast food joints and gud restaurants in dubai... the hotel has its own pub and a karoke bar where u can relax and have drinks and if u love to sing hindi english songs u can have a chance to show ur talent over there... I would rate the hotel a 4*

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: markopolo57
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Dubai on a very late night. Pickup arranged by the hotel was efficient and comfortable. No misses. Was assigned to a nice deluxe room on the seventh floor with a decent view. Room had a separate social area sitout with large working TV and a small dining area. The room was very clean and functional. Good clean bathrooms with very decent amenities. Bed was king sized, large and very comfortable. I had excellent quality of sleep on both the nights that I stayed. Breakfast was complimentary and had a good choice including Indian vegetarian. Only hassle was that the internet in room, very pricey never worked. But wireless was complimentary in all the common areas, lounges and hence was not an inhibiotr to getting work done. Great city location with proximity to restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: CEMMM
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Room was great, good beds, nice bathroom. Lots of TV channels. AC was if anything too powerful. Close enough to Old Dubai to walk. Only issue was the front desk staff weren't well informed on locations of some things in city. Our biggest complaint was there was no free wifi (lobby area was spotty), and getting it through the room was pricey (60cents/min up to a max $21USD within 24hrs. Otherwise, everything was in working order. Solid choice, and from our understanding it's fairly reasonable for Dubai – we paid $115/night incl tax.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not memorable”
Reviews.Author: KelMelt
Reviews.Content: The Majestic Hotel was completely fine but not the most memorable part of our trip to Dubai. Given the cost of 4 and 5 star hotels though, we definitely received good value ifor our money. Our flight was delayed and our group of 15 did not arrive at the Majestic Hotel until 1AM. The hotel staff was very accommodating and had dinner waiting for us in their downstairs pub. The rooms were small but modern and those above the 6th floor had spectacular views of the Dubai skyline. There were current and free magazines in the room as well as a safe and complimentary water. The gym was very disappointing - it was tiny and only had 4 pieces of cardio equipment - all of which were several years old. The business center hours were extremely limited - it closed at 6 each night. Luckily the front desk staff allowed us to use their personal computer to check flight information. There were only two elevators in the entire hotel which made travel very time-consuming. The Greek restaurant with the breakfast buffet was delicious with fresh fruit, waffles and several other hot items, and numerous cereal selections. I only visited the pub but the hotel had other restaurants/bars that seemed lively and fun. There was free wi-fi in all common areas. The location was only okay - it took several minutes to cab to the downtown areas.

Reviews.Title: “DEFINITELY NOT FOR LEISURE”
Reviews.Author: Burnsbys
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a fortnights holiday for my fiancee and I in a deluxe room. Arriving at the hotel (via a £11 airport transfer fee), which is half that in a taxi. I was Impressed with the hotel, the check in and initially the room, which was spacious with what seemed like a massive bed (two singles together) a brilliant balcony and a bathroom which contained a bath which was the biggest i had ever seen. However, the balcony had no furniture in it so we had to move the chairs out there, which where moved back in to our room as soon as we turned our backs!. The bath! well we discovered that it was fed with hot water from a tank 1/4 the size of it! therefore it took about two hours to fill, with about ten kettle loads of hot water added aswell. (the kettle had to be put on the floor as the cable was too short to reach the socket) I had to leave a note for houskeeping to get my tea/coffee replenished daily Do not attempt to use the inroom internet connection as it is extremely slow and very expensive, however the WIFI is good in all public areas in the hotel we ordered room service which was adequate but nothing special. The food in Barrels bar was not much better. we ordered what was descibed as 'irish pork sausages' and turned out to be german frankfurters fried!!! gross! the chicken caeser salad was dressed in what tasted like the deep fat frier residue and the cans of coke came in at £4 a can!! Breakfast was OK but if the hotel is full be prepared for a battle for tables and also dodging other guests whilst carrying your french toast in one hand, you fruit juice in the other and your tea/coffee on your head. If you leave your table it gets cleared so carrying all your supplies is standard. The swimming pool is a waste of time. don't plan on lazing by the pool all day as you spend the first 2 hours 'chasing the sun' around the patio!, as the building next door casts a huge shadow before you go inside defeated. The lift; again if the hotel is busy you will have a wait, two small vehicles ferry guests from the ground to the 27th floor! it became so bad we had to use the stairs a few times(we were on the 14th floor!) we stayed new years eve and attended the party by the pool! The main barman was rude and ignorant and charged my fiancee 4 times for a glass of wine than what the other staff charged. then ignored our arguments. In summary there where bad points plus good points, staff friendliness, cleanliness of rooms and hotel ad view from our balcony, but i wouldnt stay here again for leisure, Maybe if i were visiting on business and needed a decent hotel in Bur Dubai would i consider staying again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel! Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Armithiya
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel! Value for Money , superb hotel and staff is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: whereisdave
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few hours- paid for and arranged by Emirates since I had a layover that qualified. Comfortable room, helpful staff. Just down the road there is a 24hr supermarket and a KFC that is open late. About 15min drive form airport. Taxi to Dubai Mall/Burj Kalifa is about 25 dirhams. Free internet in the cafe area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good views, bit far from centre, but close to airport”
Reviews.Author: adman246
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business and had a great time. Specifically asked for a room with a view of the city skyline, and was not disappointed. An absolutely fantastic view. My room was large and comfortable, and worthy of a 4 star hotel. Plenty of eating options within the hotel and the food was good, as well as reasonably priced. Nice outside pool, although only parts of it catch the sun at certain times of the day, due to being blocked by other buildings. Hotel was less than 10 mins from the airport and about 15 mins from the Dubai Mall by taxi (depending on traffic - did take over a hour one day). I might be tempted to stay a bit nearer to the centre next time I go, as I did feel I spent far too much time sitting in taxis. Hotel was reasonably priced, so well worth staying there if you don't mind a 20 min taxi ride to the main attractions each day.

Reviews.Title: “very courteous and polite staff”
Reviews.Author: punamaswani
Reviews.Content: The room view, ammenities and service was excellent. Above all the service of the staff was amazing. Best hotel with best rates in BUR dubai. The inhouse entertainment was superb. From Live music lounge to karoke Bar to breathers BAR was so convenient. the fitness centre and swimming pool was like icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: uniquelettersnumbers
Reviews.Content: we stayed three nights in this hotel as a stopover on our way to Europe. The hotel is located close to the airport ( about 15mins by taxi) which was convenient. Unfortunately to get anywhere in Dubai, you seem to need a taxi so we think the location was fine. Nowhere seemed to be "ideally" located. We liked the breakfast, particularly the bircher muesli which not all hotels offer. Our son contracted the rota virus ( as we later found out in hospital) the day before we were supposed to fly to Europe and the hotel were excellent. They arranged a doctor to call. When he didn't respond to the doctor's treatment, the Night Manager called an ambulance and told us not to worry, he would keep the room open while we extended our stay. We didn't experience any problems with the lifts as I think we used them at off peak times. The only let down was the staff on reception. Check-in after a 14 hour flight was slow as was check-out. The value for money at this hotel we think was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Barniaou
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Dubai and quite good location. You have to walk about 10 min to the nearest metro station but that's ok. I had a room on the 19th floor with a fantastic with. Breakfast is continental and plenty. Small swimming pool but at least it's there. Great service by all the staff member. There's a pub called 3 barrels on level one and there's all the football you might want. The manager even showed the game that I wanted from a web site. Rooms and bed confortable, although drinks from mini fridge are expensive, especially alcool. Then I had a whole day and most of the following night to wait for my next flight and they took care of my bag for me no problem and no extra charge so that was very good. No free internet, but you can get it in the room, but no wifi so that wasnt very practical, only Ethernet connection available.

Reviews.Title: “2 small lifts for 30 floors, do not forget your staff in your room”
Reviews.Author: Ahmad_king
Reviews.Content: Hello, I stayed at majestic hotel for 4 nights. the room was a bit small. But the main problem was the lifts. they have only 2 lifts for the entire 30 floors and it is always crowded and alot of waitnig. also, the breakfast area is so small and it is so crowded with average food selections. in addition I have forgotten 3 shirts and did not relise that till I opened my bags at home. Contacted them and received strange answer that only 1 is found. when I asked to do some investigation , their room manager replied rudly stating it was my mistake and we are not theifes and we know how to dress our staff nicely. I will never come back or recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service but mostly business hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Des_1982
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Dubai in this hotel in a very comfortable room overlooking the city of Dubai! Location is excellent, right in the middle of Bur Dubai and only 3 minutes walking to the Burjuman/Khalid Bin Al Waleed metro station! We had dinner at Elia Restaurant and it was amazing Greek food! Also Tirquaz 24hours restaurant was very nice and clean! Breakfast was also served there and I really loved the fact that I could order my own custom made omelet made by a very happy cooker!!! I didn't liked Breathers bar, but that's only because I do not like old style bars, but in any case I was amased of cleanliness! I used Business center just to check my e-mails! Good and fast connection but I wish that it didn't close so early... I must say that all the staff were friendly and extremely polite except the receptionists, I always had the impresion they didn't wanted to speak to clients even during check-in & check out... They did talked to us only when we wanted to book dessert safari, which means money for them... My general impression is that this is a perfect business hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliness abound”
Reviews.Author: RiccardoEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Majestic Hotel Dubai many times and always found the staff to be extremely helpful and friendly. Restaurant food reasonably priced and tasty although sometimes it can arrive not very hot.. Room service orders have to be explained in detail exactly what you require or you will get the wrong thing. ie. order marmalade you will get Jam. The swimming pool area is on average a windy raea but the sun makes up for that.. The pool is adequate in size and the staff there very pleasant. Taxis readily available, and city location excellent although it is quite far from the beach but then you can't have it both ways in a big city.10 minutes to several malls and cinemas and the current main attraction the " Burge Kalifa" currently the tallest building in the world. 10 minutes will take you to a couple of golf courses 25 minutes to the Els,the Montgomerie anr the Emiriates golf courses and the Ski centre.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: mattsmum43
Reviews.Content: me and my daughter stayed here and it was 5* all the way.The rooms are lovely and the standard of cleanliness is 1st class.Reception staff were very helpful and only too willing to answer all our questions and the buffet breakfast was plentiful

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Nikoglinio
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, the employees were very helpful and the room was very clean. The hotel has a beer house in the first floor, a place that offers the opportunity for a drink. Also there was a greek restaurant in the second floor, a good choice for dinner. The unique disadvantage of the hotel was that our room was in the 3rd floor and we had no view. The hotel has 28 floors (i think so) and the first ten have no view.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: gypsy1982
Reviews.Content: Everyone was VERY friendly at the hotel Majestic! The had a great house band at the Music Room (the hotel bar). The taxi drivers all drove like maniacs, but it is a beautiful place and I would love to go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dua1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this holtel for a 04 days. The Hotel was basically neat and clean. Reception staff was more businesslike could have been more friendlier. Romms were clean but small. Breakfast spread was good. our hotel had a view of Burj Al Khalifa- Highest building in world. In shoort an okay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Should be a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: karol85
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel from the moment we stepped through the door. Reception staff very helpfull even offering to book a safari for us. Rooms were beautyfull with a reall nice view. We were dropped of by shuttle to the hotel. Hotel offers a free shuttle to the shopping complex near by. Breakfast is just amazing, you can just spend hours in there :P We arrived late at night and were hungry so we went downstairs to a 24 hour restaurant and had one of the best carbonara pastas i have ever tasted. There is a swimming pool outside even though i didnt use it had a look whilist i was having breakfast. Short taxi ride to the gold market. Mini bar very well stocked and for the cheapest prices i have ever seen at a hotel. Smoking rooms available

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious here.. luxurious there.. luxurious everywhere.. (at an amazingly decent price)..!!”
Reviews.Author: thewanderer-nammo
Reviews.Content: i just loved my stay here.. Majestic is majestically majestic.. i am not able to make up as to from where shall i start.. from its 5(may be more) award winning restaurants/pubs/clubs.. to the huge swimming pool.. to the breathtaking views it offers from the rooms..to the way too huge rooms it offers.. the lavish bath..massively huge bath tub.. plentiful of wardrobe space.. pool size bar-b-q.. perfect location.. and much much more.. Majestic is one hotel which i believe falls into those 'will-never-disappoint' category.. what breakfast it used to offer besides the pool side cafe.. exceptional front desk and house keeping.. what awesome views.. and above all.. at a very very decent price.. i wont say anything further.. book it right away.. if you like it - thank me ..if u dont - well dont worry it wont happen.. so go there.. relax, enjoy and feel majestic..

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: ammu6630
Reviews.Content: The Majestic's 28 floors are home to the hotels 252 guest rooms. Rooms are stylishly furnished, extremely comfortable and well-equipped with a range of modern amenities including luxury bathrooms. The hotel features a total of 7 restaurants and bars, offering the guest a fantastic choice of cuisine and atmosphere. The hotels new urban chic restaurant, Tirquaz, offers a great à la carte menu and guests can witness the chefs in action at the live cooking stations. Leisure facilities at the Majestic Hotel Tower include an outdoor swimming pool with sundeck. There is also a health club with sauna and steam room. Beach lovers will appreciate the hotels complimentary shuttle service to Dubai's sandy shores.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad first impression”
Reviews.Author: Finnlady59
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we were given the standard room instead of the deluxe room we had booked. When we asked about this in the reception we got a really nasty treatment from the receptionist. He moved us to a deluxe room in the 6th floor opposite of an ugly building. So much for the view we were promised! When we asked him is this his idea of a revenge he moved us to another room, this time to a smoking room even though we had booked a non-smoking room. Finally he moved us to the fourth room and it was exactly what we had booked. I just don't understand why we didn't get that room in the beginning. This one receptionist was luckily the exception among the staff. Others were great, especially our bellboy. The breakfast was also good. We were a little bit disappointed with the Friday Brunch at Barrels, propably should have chosen Elia.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Aleksandra41
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7.days in april 2009,the accomodations was clean,comfortable...everybody was frendly and fun,the food was super.We have really enjoyed and I looking forward to going back .Great town,hotel,people...I love Dubai!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, clean & spacious rooms with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: AMarilyn
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the Majestic Hotel. Room was large with great view of city skyline. Only downside for us was the location, we probably should have stayed closer to the city and malls as that's where most of our time was spent. Wasn't much to see around the hotel that was in walking distance, we needed taxis everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “decent, serviceable”
Reviews.Author: gravitycollapse
Reviews.Content: Recently had a quick stopover in Dubai and chose this hotel because it wasn't too expensive. It is what it is; a clean, serviceable hotel with few frills, though there are a couple of eating options on-site, and a bar downstairs. It could work for a businessperson, for budget-conscious travellers, or for a family. At night there are some prostitutes not too far away from the hotel, down the street, but from my perspective the area was far from "seedy". There are a couple of 24-hour supermarkets within walking distance, as well as some cafés, so the location is convenient; you don't feel like you're stuck eating in the hotel restaurant. It was always easy to get a taxi there. My only complaint was that when I checked out, I stored my bag with them to go out and buy a few things before heading off to the airport, and retrieving my bag took much longer than it should have, because they were busy with checkouts, but this wasn't so bad. All in all a very serviceable, if unspectacular, hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but there are better places to stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: nicole9914
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and clean and the staff try there best but they have limited english and some struggled to understand us. Regards the location it is not the best it is surrounded by Indian and Pakistani people no arabic people at all and lets just say it could be a cleaner area. It is around a 20 minute walk to the creek area where you can get a traditional water taxi which is a small wooden boat across the water to the gold and spice markets. There were call girls on the street outside the hotel at the weekend but these never caused us any bother and never approached us. There is a large super market 5 mins walk down the road that is very very good like a Asda style super market and its open 24hrs, there are also a few different shopping centres a few minutes walk away with some very good and cheap food courts in them with everything fron KFC, McDonalds and lots of little indian, chinese and pizza restaurants we used these quite a lot and had some fantastic cheap food. The rooms were very clean and spacious for the money BUT the main problem was the air conditioning system was very very noisey it sounded like every so often someone was emptying a bucket of water with ice cubes in it which would wake us up. The lifts were not the best only 2 lifts for all 24 floors and they got very busy at breakfast and other busy times of the day. The pool area was very nice and never got crowded so there was always a sunbed available. the room service was very quick and the prices very good and the food was a very good standard and plenty of it. There is a free shuttle bus to various shopping malls, beaches and other points of interest every day which leaves the hotel at 10am and picks you back up at 2pm, but taxis are very cheap and the metro line which is a 20 minute walk from the hotel was very good value it cost us around £2 each to go 1st class (gold class) and that was to the furthest point around 20 miles away to dubai marina. Overall my opinion is that the hotel is good value and very clean but the area it is in is not the best but its very easy and cheap to get a taxi to where you want to go so why pay silly money for a better location when you can stop here for a lot less, would i return yes i would but i would also check out a better location just in case there were any simular priced hotels in a better place. Dubai is far from finished and is like a huge huge building site with road works every where would i go back yes i would in about 5 years when all the diggers and cranes have moved on.

Reviews.Title: “One Rude Staff Ruined the Stay”
Reviews.Author: psl
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was nice and clean with good facilities. The airport pickup service was excellent and the restaurant staff was extremely friendly. Hotel staff at the front desk who appeared to be Asians were cordial and helpful. However, one native man at the desk on another night was rude and uncooperative. Perhaps if you are a caucasian man, he may treat you differently. Because of this experience, the rating given is 3 instead of a 4.

Reviews.Title: “A functional hotel, with excellent service and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Crayfish69
Reviews.Content: On the balance of reviews on Trip Advisor, we selected the Majestic Tower Hotel for our 2 week stay in Dubai. Located in the Bur-Dubai district, it is easily accessible to both the City, if a little distant from, the beach hotels and attractions at Jumerieh (approximately 20 minutes in a cab, at off-peak times). We arrived at 2am and the staff we were welcomming and helpful. Our room was situated on the 12th floor, with excellent views looking west over Dubai. Facilities within the room were what you would expect from a 4 star brand, but were nothing special (no flat screen tv, for example). That being said, other facilities within the hotel were excellent and excelled above its star listing (pool, gym and various restaurants and bars). We were particularly fond of the Greek restaurant 'Elia', and were pleased to celebrate its 2nd birthday. The 'Music Room' was lively and the karokee bar was an added benefit! My only criticism was the deficiency of lifts within the hotel. By design, 2 lifts serving 24 storeys can only be described as deficient. In summary, an great hotel, well run and with added benefit of friendly and approachable staff. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: kayBham
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival our room was not ready, told to wait 30 minutes, upon enquiring after 30 minutes was told another 20 minutes and seatted in reception and not acknowledged!! eventually once complaining room became available. Once in room discovered shower did not work, sent maintenance to repair after a 71/2 hour flight not happy!! maintenance could not fix. I called reception spoke with manager who rectified immediatley apologised upgraded our room free, with complimentrary fruit etc... after this experienced problems constantly with our room key!! not the best start to our holiday. Good value for money apart from problems checking in and room key good hotel and friendley especially Beejay bell boy!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic And Friendly Service - Best Value Four Star Hotel In Dubai!”
Reviews.Author: KevinThailand
Reviews.Content: Undoubtedly the best value for money four star hotel anywhere in Dubai. A prompt air port pick-up, smooth check in with efficient and helpful reception staff immediately gave us a good feeling that here was a hotel where the entire staff really do go that extra mile to make you feel ‘at home’ from the moment you walk into the foyer. The room was more than spacious enough, tastefully furnished throughout, a large bathroom with Jacuzzi type bath….in fact everything we needed, or was ever likely to need, was in place down to the smallest items. The breakfast restaurant was located on the pool side with a modern vibrant theme and the breakfast itself was excellent with a wide varied selection of hot and cold dishes, fruits, juices and a never ending supply of tea or coffee…again the staff where ever attentive, efficient and friendly. The Greek restaurant is a must to visit, the food was superb and good value….. each time we dined there it was always busy, usually with Greek expats so the food must have been authentic! The last mention must go to the ‘Music Room’, the large down stairs live music venue which besides having one of the best rock bands we’d heard in a long time, the ‘Rock Spiders’ of Philippines origin, it again offers a great selection of European and Asian foods at reasonable prices. For those who like to shoot a game of pool there is a separate upper tier pool area that does not interfere with those people who wish to relax listening to the music….yet again Rajeev and his staff cannot be thanked enough for their excellent service. All in all, I can honestly say that we would not hesitate to recommend the Majestic Towers Hotel to anyone staying in Dubai. A bad choice in hotel can either make or break your holiday and without a doubt the Majestic Towers Hotel and its extra helpful and friendly staff made our stay in Dubai a memorable one and we will most certainly stay there again on our next visit to Dubai!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Garnet007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Majestic Hotel for 5 days and was very impressed with the staff...from the minute I steped into the lobby till the minute I left. First class. Great food...really like the relax feeling in the sports bar. Booked a few trips through the hotel and was very pleased with both trips and the way the hotel staff handled my requests. Would I stay there again...you bet.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic - Real value for money”
Reviews.Author: RobinDubai
Reviews.Content: I always thought that Majestic Hotel was just an ordinary hotel like a lot of them in its vicinity. However my perception changed as I stayed in the hotel. - First really good impression, the guys at the reception - Chester & Roshan, checked us in early in the morning and more suprisingly gave us an upgrade to its deluxe suites. Wow!...that was something nice to start are stay with. - Naushad from Belldesk, amazing personality...always a smile and willing to help. - The room service menu not that elaborate however very well priced. - Housekeeping very good at thier work, however their grooming and uniform could be much better. - Amazing views of the city from the huge balcony. - The standout service of the entire stay was undoubtedly the F&B outlets, namely Tirquaz for breakfast and Elia for dinner. The breakfast at Tirquaz had everything you wanted. We tried Elia - the greek restaurant for dinner and the service was absolutely mind-blowing. The service by the girl's (don't remember thier names), was simply outstanding. The food and it's presentation excellent and very peaceful ambiance. I think the management under-rates this restaurant and it should advertise a bit about this restaurant in Dubai. - The only place which was a bit slack in its service was at the pool. The guys around the pool really looked disinterested probably because of bad weather conditions prevailing and also had to wait for a long time to get our drinks bill. Otherwise a good weekend spend at the Majestic Dubai - its really worth, real value for money. ------------------------------- RS

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, great service”
Reviews.Author: dsefri
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. Everyone was so nice and helpful. Some areas apparently have been recently renovated. Fantastic value. Not to mention the view from my room was absolutely amazing. Only disadvantage is the hotel shuttle bus to the beach is not daily.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean, comfortable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PapM
Reviews.Content: I had an enjoyable stay. The rooms were spacious and tasteful and more importantly very clean. Great bathroom with a huge tub. I had a breathtaking view of the skyscrapers of downtown Dubai. The staff was professional but friendly - I got to check into my room early at no extra charge. Breakfast had a good international selection of items, very fresh and in a nice dining area overlooking the pool. Given the nice weather, I could walk to nearby shopping areas. The Greek restaurant of the hotel is exceptional. Room service was not bad. I used the sauna/steam room and also checked out the Music Room with live music which was fun. All in all, I found this hotel a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jsy-traveller
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and reasonably furnished, I could not get a hot shower bespite asking for the shower to be fixed, my colleague staying on the same floor could not get anything but a red hot shower, go figure! The area leave a little to be desired at night, it is certainly not where I would want to stay on holiday. The pool area is small, the gym is ok but small, breakfast was reasonable and the Greek restaurant very good. There are a couple of bars, a sports bar that was empty most nights, a bar on the ground floor which was very smokey and a music bar with alive band each night which was accessed from outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here - beware!”
Reviews.Author: moledicer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice enough but the staff are completely incompetent. I am still waiting for them to refund the AED10000 visa deposit that they took from me over a month after I left the country. I have no idea whether I will ever get it back and now the credit card company is about to charge me a massive interest charge due to the Majestic's incompetenece (or fraudulent behaviour) Our experience with the staff here is never to be repeated so I would recommend steering well clear of this hotel

Reviews.Title: “If there is a chance to mess up, the Majestic will.”
Reviews.Author: OsloBob1963
Reviews.Content: New hotel with nice rooms. Most of the staff however, have no idea of how hotels are supposed to function. We booked three rooms with an extra bed in each. I spent my whole evening trying to get the extra beds in place before the children fell asleep. Nothing had been fixed before we got to the hotel. Nothing happened after we had told the reception about the extra beds and returned from sightseeing. Nothing happened when we returned to our rooms in the evening and expected the beds to be there. After leaving the hotel for a short trip to Oman we discovered a missing teddybear. We had all sorts of trouble getting it back when we returned to Dubai a few days later.... Very strange hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room, terrible food”
Reviews.Author: calgaryglobetrotter8
Reviews.Content: Lets start off with the good. I stayed in a deluxe room. The room was very nice, it was huge, very well decorated, clean and had an amazing view of he Dubai bussiness district. The bathroom had a soaker tub, and shower. Now the bad. This is a fairly large hotel, but only has two elevators, so you wind up waiting a very long time fro an elevator. Although the hotel has two bars, and two restaurants, and room service, the food quality is terrible. The food is very processed, tasteless and just not very good in general. Overall though I'd say that, considering the very low cost of a room, I think it worked out to about a hundred and twenty $us a nigh, this hotel is a very good value, I would just reccomend eating somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “One to avoid....”
Reviews.Author: Jimboza
Reviews.Content: Like to many Dubai Hotels, there is lots of bling, but very little heart. In the case of the Majestic there was also ample evidence of incompetent management. They just never responded to any e-mail requests which left me almost not being able to do the work I needed to do in Dubai since they just never arranged a visa. Then, despite 3 e-mails giving my flight number, time of arrival etc. they just did not send anyone to pick me up at the airport. After an overnight flight I was left standing in the arrivals hall from 5AM until almost 7AM, three phonecalls from me and one from the helpful travel counter eventually resulted in someone coming to fetch me. On the way back I had to direct the driver to the new Terminal 3 at Dubai airport. (The driver insisted in dropping me off at the Royal Terminal, which I unfortunately don't qualify for :-) ) I guess Dubai is about as far removed from a hospitality industry where the owner acutally cares as you can get. I don't expect much in the way of care from underpaid expats, but the Majestic takes the cake. Pretty nice Greek restaurant though, if you like very pricey meals. In general another "capital investment" rather than a hotel with heart.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price.”
Reviews.Author: _forevergreen_Uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights and have to stay thought the hotel was v. good. Live music from two bands in the music bar each night. Amazing greek restaurant on another floor. Sports bars on another floor. Rooms modern with wired and wireless internet connections. Free valet parking. Would definately stop there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: beamsnsparkles
Reviews.Content: Stayed with husband for a couple of nights en route to Thailand. Lovely spacious room. We arrived really early and were upgraded to a superior room as ours wasn;t ready. HUGE round sunken bath took ages to fill though. Nice sitting area with sofas and huge warrdrobes and dressing area. Nice enough breakfast but to be honest nothing special if I'm honest. Location was OK although the 10 minute walk to the bus stop for the bus tour wasn't quite 10 minutes given the blistering heat. Cabs are cheap enough to over come this though. Its cheaper for petrol in Dubai than water Mr Brown!!! Pool area was relaxing. Tour lady was very helpful even though we booked a tour and then made her cancel it as we spotted the REAL dune buggies in a leaflet that dropped out of her folder! An amazing trip to take tha you drive the dune buggies (not quads) having been picked up in a hummer. Dinner at the top of the Emerates tower was amazing, fantastic views. Cheapest wine on the massive wine list was £50 though!!!

Reviews.Title: “Check your statement”
Reviews.Author: satell7
Reviews.Content: this is a greek hotel that does not live up to the arabic hospitality and good service that you find all over Dubai its a baic highrise hotel but in a good location clean rooms and cheap ( or thats what i thought ) on my return home i found that they had charged 500AED to my account that should have read temporary block and been released within 15 days the return of my money is going to be a pain to sort out but i am glad that it was my credit card and not my debit that i used when we checked in so if you have stayed here i would take a scond look at your statement

Reviews.Title: “Quite impressive”
Reviews.Author: aussietraveller12323
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Majestic for 3 nights and was impressed with the whole package. It isn't a 5 star, but they don't claim to be. It's in a great location if you want to explore the city by foot. The staff were fantastic and very professional. Great bars within the hotel. Only downside, the depth of the pool! But overall had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Majestic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeHibby
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Majestic recently for 3 nights and I have to say it was terrible. The building was originally designed as apartments which is why the public areas and amenities are so small. Breakfast was a disaster every morning, the food in general was very poor quality. The worst aspect of the hotel is its willingness to allow the 'ladies of the night' to operate in the bar on the ground floor. After 11pm each night the place was awash with hookers. The Indian Management seemed to be turning a blind eye. Stay well away unless you like that sort of thing.

Reviews.Title: “what makes a great hotel is the staff”
Reviews.Author: roscoe39
Reviews.Content: there is little I can add to the recent reviews other than to add that the hotel is good value for money and the crew running the hotel were freindly efficient and more than happy to help. I arrived early int he morning and even though my room wasnt ready the receptionist did a great job in getting me into a room as soon as possible which after a long flight was very much appreciated. For a brief stopover it was a great hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Dubai”
Reviews.Author: martin_boro3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Majestic for 4 days in early March on a stopover. First, it's unfair to try to compare this hotel with, say, one of the Jumeirah chain as it costs a fraction of the price. Some of the negative points raised in previous reviews are correct, namely the lack of lifts meaning lengthy waits or the stairs and that to be sure of a table and good selection for breakfast buffet (included in price) you need to get down there 8/8.30 am, plus pool in sun most of day except early morning. Location not bad for Creek, Wafi City, Karama, but looking at 25-30 mins in taxi to Jumeirah (avoid peak hours as this becomes more than an hour!) Staff were all friendly and helpful. Rooms fairly spacious, well equipped and kept very clean. 2 bars in the hotel. 'Barrels'sports bar good (obviously) for sport with loads of pasmas and sofas with their own screens so you can select what you want to watch. Karaoke bar a bit dead but got cheap all-inclusive food & drink deals. Didn't eat in bars as I reckon they do drink better so I leave food to restaurants - Greek restaurant in hotel very good and good dining at neighbouring hotels also. Good place to stay for a few days, good value for money, just be prepared to take cabs a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for the price”
Reviews.Author: larsandrowjacobsen
Reviews.Content: I felt this hotel was very good value for money, we had a spacious room which was always spotlessly clean and well stocked. The pool could be a little bigger but was well placed and the staff around the area were very attentive. The guys who order the taxis/valet men are very friendly and heplful. My big complaint with this hotel would be the food/cocktails - I didnt try the Greek restaurant which has apparently won awards but I did order room service, meals near the pool and in Barrels the sports bar. I felt the choices were very limited and what there was wasn't very good quality. We found ourselves walki ng to the nearby Sheraton at times to get better food. Also the cocktails served around the pool and at Barrels are not very good, especially when you have tasted those at the Hilton! This was a major down side for us as we love to drink cocktails around the pool. Overall I would say this is an okay hotel especially if you are on a budget but personally I would rather pay the extra and stay in a Jumeirah hotel such as the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: martinmatousek
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel in the old part of Dubai. Miles away from beaches and modern part of Dubai. Can recommeded for people,who like be in touch with the city, but dont' want to be in the middle of building sites. Went to Dubai for hols and could not pay E 400/per night in one of the beach resorts. This hotel is less than E 200 a night, with great service and big rooms. It's just far away to anywhere from here .-) But the pool is nice and the Olio restaurant beautifull. Stuff is very helpfull,decent and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel / City Location”
Reviews.Author: Moose-groupie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic Hotel on a two day stop-over. We chose the hotel as we wanted to be in Dubai city and not on the beach. Hotel was very average but clean, friendly staff and good location for Creek (10 minute walk). The breakfast was very good although items often ran out and were not replaced very quickly. Tried the sports bar at the hotel and found it to be soul-less. I would use the hotel again but may try something else first.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: AZERBA
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience. You smell food everyday after breakfast due to lack of an appropriate ventilation system in the breakfast room. Regardless, cook still keeps cooking certain meals in the breakfast room and the smoke covers the whole room. Two elevators of the hotel are not sufficient. Waste lots of time waiting for elevators. Noise isolation of the rooms is poor. You can hear your neighbour taking shower. Hotel staff does not know their responsibilities. Hotel book says there is shoe shine, the staff says hotel does not provide this service

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: dephazz99
Reviews.Content: OK, it was a big fair. But there werde big problems to get into the elevator and you smell like food every morning after breakfast. Breakfast room is far too small when people come alltogether! But still it was a nice and clean room and Bathroom OK. Very good shuttle to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: deeps23
Reviews.Content: The Majestic Hotel is a really nice place to stay with a reasonable price to pay. The rooms and hotel is very clean. The bathrooms are nice and clean also. The staff is very friendly and willing to help you. The location is great also you are near Meena Bazar and the Gold Souk. Overall I was pleased with my stay in December 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic occasionally....”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyLiverpool
Reviews.Content: A combination of rude guests, poor service at breakfast and the worst lifts we have ever experienced meant that the Majestic left us slightly disappointed. Perhaps staying over the New Years Eve period led to service levels being poorer than usual, however we refused to let this spoil what was otherwise a fantastic stay in Dubai If you stay in this hotel be prepared to have to rely on sometimes expensive taxis to be able to get anywhere. We tried walking to the beach one day and struggled to find pavements to walk on due to all of the building work.

Reviews.Title: “Charlie at the Majestic is SOOOOO helpful and professional”
Reviews.Author: Luv2SeeThings
Reviews.Content: the majestic hotel is very clean and well organized, except for the cigarette smoke in the lobby.......not a fabulous gym. it only has 3 or 4 machines so its VERY basic....also, they have no steam room, or at least if they do it wasnt working. they do have a dry sauna, but didnt use it, so cant comment on it, pool area is very nice, great for a little people watching ..........breakfast is very good and the staff very efficient and professional.......beside the smoking in the lobby, this hotel is very very clean...........a front desk employee, Charlie, was extremely helpful in his knowledge of the city and arranging accomodation for our day trips. he's definately an asset to the hotel as he makes it easy to understand about the city/tours/bar lounges, etc and seemed sincerely happy to help....thank u charlie!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: digginduggo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights, and found it was a brilliant hotel. The staff were incredibly friendly, without hanging around expecting a tip. The location is great - you can walk to Bastakaya, the museum, the creek, and get an Abra over to Deira. Plenty of other hotels nearby, if you fancy something different to eating in the majestic, although the food there was great. Breakfast choice was amazing, and we never once ate lunch as we were still to full after breakfast. The hotel does a bus to a different place each day, either a mall or beach. We got the bus to Mall of the Emirates and then took a taxi to Wild Wadi. We didn't get the hotel bus home, as it returns at 1pm, but the return taxi from the Mall of the Emirates to the Majestic was only 37AED - and that's for a 30 minute/20KM journey! Only two negatives: the pick up at the airport didn't turn up, but to be honest it's as easy to just jump in a taxi. And the pool, although lovely, is freezing - the heater is broken and they really need to get it fixed!

Reviews.Title: “stay in dubai - no problems”
Reviews.Author: lintoj
Reviews.Content: the stay in majestic is smooth, no hiccups, no surprises. clean, neat place, with a very good breakfast and near to most places.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: weezworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic for three nights in November 2007. The hotel is very clean, rooms are adequately equipped, beds are comfortable and the staff are very helpful and friendly. We emailed ahead and asked for the hotel to supply us with a transfer from the airport. This was good value and cheaper than getting a taxi-as we found out on the way back! There is a pool, but due to the height of the surrounding buildings it is quite shaded with only a small area getting any sun at any one time. Not conducive to a good sun tanning session. A nice pool however, although a little lacking in sun beds. Check in was straight forward and we were able to get into our room at 12.00 midday. The first morning we were there we went to breakfast at around 10am. We were unable to get a seat/table as it was packed. There was no queuing system and we ended up going without even though it was included in our room rate. The second morning we got up earlier and were able to get a table. Breakfast was a good selection of all the usual items on a self service buffet. The hotel itself is 10/15 minutes drive from the airport. It takes about 30 minutes to get to the beach and the only transport option is a taxi. This cost between 50-70 UAE dirhams each way. There is a hotel shuttle once per day to the beach or other areas of interest - it leaves the hotel at 10am and returns at 1.00pm and only goes to one place per day. Jumeirah Beach Park is a good option, nice beach and clear sea. Very clean and nicely landscaped park area. Wafi Pyramids are in fairly close proximity to the hotel (you'll need a taxi though) and a really good option for a few restaurant choices. Try Asha's-well worth a visit. See separate review for our dinner at the Burj Al Arab.

Reviews.Title: “Traffic makes it too far from the beach”
Reviews.Author: LondonBella29
Reviews.Content: Our first impressions of the The Majestic Tower hotel were great. Clean, nicely decorated, large rooms and friendly staff. It is an ideal place to stay if you want to explore Bur Dubai and the old town. However because we wanted to spend a week on the beach we ended up having to take taxi's to all the beach resorts. Not too far on the map but rush hour in Dubai means you can be sat in traffic for up to an hour.....Taxi's are cheap but still, this was valuable tanning time! Once you reach hotels along Jumeriah Beach you realise that in the scheme of things in dubai, Majestic Towers really is quite a modest hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hardly Majestic”
Reviews.Author: Kilseany
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Majestic twice in two months, and was reluctant to write a review until seeing the operation over time. The rooms themselves are nice-well decorated and clean. The bathrooms equally clean. The lobby is always active, if you are sensitive to cigarette smoke you may have an issue-many europeans stay there and smoke in the lobby...so beware. You will usually wait for an elevator, there are only two for 24 floors. Get the breakfast option, it is buffet style and very nice-enough choices that it won't become rutine over a few days. The pub in the lobby has four computers that allow you to acess the internet for email-sometimes they will ask you to buy a drink to use during busy times. Bellmen are very good, they hustle for you, and are grateful for a couple of dhs tip. By far the worst of this hotel are the front desk staff. My first stay at this hotel I waited over two hours for a room, they claimed none were clean and kept promising "ready in 30 mins." My second stay I was assigned a smoking room even though I require a non-smoking, and after one night I was given a better room (nice) but it had a thermostat that was stuck on full cold and you could hear water running from the floors above occasionally. Any complaints given to the staff are usually dismissed by a lack of understanding of English. You get what you pay for. I can't advise you to stay away but don't expect 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “3 nights for the price of one!!”
Reviews.Author: caitrynne
Reviews.Content: We booked through [--] as we found the cheapest rate there incl. taxes and breakfast and we booked from the 22- 25th of Sept - bang in centre of Ramadan´for our stopover to Oz. We booked the Majestic mainly because of the location in the city and the price was excellent for what we could see from the photos. We booked a deluxe room for an extra few euros per night and it was worth it. Apart from our flight being delayed and the ordered pick up not being there to collect us when we arrived we thoroughly enjoyed our 3 day stay. We had an early check in (6am ) which was accomodated with a smile, all the staff were extremely friendly and our room (on the 22 floor) had fab views over the city and was really very comfortable, spacious and the bath tub was huge (although not a jacuzzi unfortunately) The pool was small but not cold as previously reviewed, and during the hottest hours it was partly shaded by the tall building beside the hotel. The breakfast buffet was great and the menu changed every day to allow for something slightly different. The evening buffet was quite good too, but nothing out of the ordinary, The pub did not serve alcohol until after 7pm (as was Ramadan) but was thronged with people enjoying the cricket matches and staff catered for everyone as there were tvs for those who prefered to watch the footie instead. I had a massage (or two) at the salon which was needed and very reasonably priced and the husband treated himself to a good cut-throat shave. The best thing though was that a copy of Time Out Dubai was placed beside the bed informing us of other places to go and eat out during Ramadan... which we did - on our savings at this 4 star during the holy period we treated ourselves to an evening of dinner and drinks at the 7 star Burj Al Arab !! (and that was also heavily discounted during Ramadan) We also took advantage of the free shuttle buses to the beach from the hotel - as it was Ramadan (sounding like a broken record I know but..) we practically had the beach to ourselves. We would definitely stay at the majestic again but only at the price we got it for .... 3 nights for the price of one outside of... yup... Ramadan ; )
